SEARCH
Package emissary.output.roller.journal

Class JournaledChannelPool

java.lang.Object
emissary.output.roller.journal.JournaledChannelPool
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable
public class JournaledChannelPool extends Object implements AutoCloseable
Pool implementation that utilizes a Journal to durably track state out written data. The implementation will create up to the maximum configured output channels. Channels are lazily initialized to minimize resource utilization. The Journal is only updated when files are created and committed.

    • getFree

      public KeyedOutput getFree() throws InterruptedException, IOException
      Returns an available output from the pool. This method will block if there are no free objects available and the max number of outputs has been created.
      Returns:
      an available KeyedOutput from the pool
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is some I/O problem.
      InterruptedException - If interrupted.

    • close

      public void close() throws InterruptedException, IOException
      Closes the underlying pool. This method will block if any resources have not been returned.
      Specified by:
